DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Tissue Fixation Expected Delay Duration
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that indicates the expected duration of delay to the biospecimen fixation process.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._The chemical preservation of a substance to maintain structural and/or molecular features of that substance as they exist in the living entity._Considered likely or probable; anticipated._Time during which some action is awaited; inactivity resulting in something being put off until a later time; the state of being slower or later.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The period of time during which something continues.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 11 and less than 13 and the quantity that it denotes.: A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 11 and less than 13 and the quantity that it denotes.
A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.

A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.
